noun.description: A process or set of rules to be followed in calculations or other problem-solving operations, especially by a computer.

origin: Late 17th century (denoting the Arabic or decimal notation of numbers): variant (influenced by Greek arithmos number) of Middle English algorism, via Old French from medieval Latin algorismus. The Arabic source, al-Ḵwārizmī the man of Ḵwārizm (now Khiva), was a name given to the 9th-century mathematician Abū Jafar Muhammad ibn Mūsa, author of widely translated works on algebra and arithmetic.
